_header: On foot should be all Scots war
Subjects: Scots, battle actions; chronicles, verse in; translations
_description: Scotia sit guerra pedibus — seven couplets translating seven Latin lines in Fordun’s Scottichronicon (Book 12, chap. 10)

CamTCC1421.First Lines: On fut suld be all scottes weirBe hyll …
CamTCC1421.Note:
14 lines, added to bottom of page in fifteenth to sixteenth
                    century.

ColumbaHse.First Lines:
One fuyt suld be all scottis weirBe hill & moss þame self
                    to weir…
ColumbaHse.Last Lines:
…This Is the Counsel & intentOf gud kinge Robertis
                    testamen[t]
ColumbaHse.Note:
7 x 2, added to lower margin of page by another hand, same as adds to
                    Latin version, ‘Scotica sit guerra peditis mons mosseta
                    terva…’ to lower margin f. 156v; in Book XXVI, ch. xi,
                    xii and xiii (all on f. clvii).
